13  package net.sf.oval.test.validator;
14  
15  import java.util.ArrayList;
16  import java.util.Collection;
17  import java.util.List;
18  
19  import javax.persistence.Entity;
20  import javax.validation.Valid;
21  import javax.validation.constraints.NotNull;
22  import javax.validation.constraints.Size;
23  
24  import junit.framework.TestCase;
25  import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
26  import net.sf.oval.Validator;
27  import net.sf.oval.configuration.annotation.BeanValidationAnnotationsConfigurer;
28  
29  /**
30   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
31   *
32   */
33  public class BeanValidationAnnotationsConfigurerTest extends TestCase
34  {
35  	@Entity
36  	protected static class TestEntity
37  	{
38  		@NotNull
39  		@Size(max = 4)
40  		public String code;
41  
42  		public String description;
43  
44  		@NotNull
45  		@Valid
46  		public TestEntity ref1;
47  
48  		@Valid
49  		public TestEntity ref2;
50  
51  		@Valid
52  		public Collection<TestEntity> refs;
53  
54  		@NotNull
55  		public String getDescription()
56  		{
57  			return description;
58  		}
59  	}
60  
61  	public void testBeanValidationAnnotationsConfigurer()
62  	{
63  		Validator v = new Validator(new BeanValidationAnnotationsConfigurer());
64  		List<ConstraintViolation> violations;
65  
66  		TestEntity entity;
67  
68  		{
69  			entity = new TestEntity();
70  
71  			violations = v.validate(entity);
72  			// code is null
73  			// description is null
74  			// ref1 is null
75  			assertEquals(3, violations.size());
76  			assertNull(violations.get(0).getInvalidValue());
77  			assertNull(violations.get(1).getInvalidValue());
78  			assertNull(violations.get(2).getInvalidValue());
79  		}
80  
81  		{
82  			entity.code = "";
83  			entity.description = "";
84  			entity.ref1 = new TestEntity();
85  
86  			violations = v.validate(entity);
87  			// ref1 is invalid
88  			assertEquals(1, violations.size());
89  		}
90  
91  		{
92  			entity.ref1.code = "";
93  			entity.ref1.description = "";
94  			entity.ref1.ref1 = entity;
95  
96  			violations = v.validate(entity);
97  			assertEquals(0, violations.size());
98  		}
99  
100 		{
101 			entity.ref2 = new TestEntity();
102 
103 			violations = v.validate(entity);
104 			// ref2 is invalid
105 			assertEquals(1, violations.size());
106 		}
107 
108 		{
109 			entity.ref2.code = "";
110 			entity.ref2.description = "";
111 			entity.ref2.ref1 = entity;
112 
113 			violations = v.validate(entity);
114 			assertEquals(0, violations.size());
115 		}
116 
117 		// Size test
118 		{
119 			entity.code = "12345";
120 			violations = v.validate(entity);
121 			// code is too long
122 			assertEquals(1, violations.size());
123 
124 			entity.code = "";
125 		}
126 
127 		// Valid test
128 		{
129 			entity.refs = new ArrayList<TestEntity>();
130 			TestEntity d = new TestEntity();
131 			entity.refs.add(d);
132 
133 			violations = v.validate(entity);
134 			assertEquals(1, violations.size());
135 
136 			d.code = "";
137 			d.description = "";
138 			d.ref1 = entity;
139 
140 			violations = v.validate(entity);
141 			assertEquals(0, violations.size());
142 		}
143 	}
144 }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
